metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5223 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 55.0.2883.75 for Mac,Windows and Linux, and 55.0.2883.84 for Android allowed a remote attackerto potentially exploit heap corruption or DoS via a crafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5223` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-browser-l10n - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-chromedriver - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263').
